intro: Simbuleta pubescens, commonly known as the hairy simbuleta, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often edible roots. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, greenish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Simbuleta pubescens is often found in moist, rocky habitats and is adapted to the cool, high-altitude environments of the Andes.
